did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: National Council for the Traditional Arts (NCTA) collection circa 1961-2008

corpname.part: National Council for the Traditional Arts

did.physdesc: 205 sound files : digital, WAV files (96 kHz, 24 bit and 44.1 kHz, 16 bit)

descriptivenote.p: In multiple languages, primarily in English.

corpname.part: American Folklife Center, Library of Congress

did.abstract: Collection of concert and workshop recordings of events at the National Folk Festivals, Lowell Folk Festivals, and other festivals, tours, and concerts sponsored by the National Council for the Traditional Arts (NCTA), formerly the National Folk Festival Association founded in 1934. Features performances and traditions from throughout the United States and from around the world.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: National Council for the Traditional Arts; Donation ; 2001.

processinfo.head: Processing History
processinfo.p: National Council for the Traditional Arts (NCTA) collection was processed by Marcia Segal and completed in 2017. Julia Kim and Maya Lerman processed the collection's digital content.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: National Folk Festival, 1972, Area 1, Area 2, Area 3 [sound recording]. https://lccn.loc.gov/2013655490
National Folk Festival, 1972, Area 1 [sound recording]. https://lccn.loc.gov/2012655213

userestrict.head: Copyright Status
userestrict.p: Duplication of collection materials may be governed by copyright and other restrictions.

accessrestrict.head: Access and Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The National Council for the Traditional Arts collection is open for research. To request materials, please contact the Folklife Reading Room at https://hdl.loc.gov/loc.afc/folklife.contact

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: National Council for the Traditional Arts (NCTA) collection (AFC 2001/019), American Folklife Center, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection of concert and workshop recordings of events at the National Folk Festivals, Lowell Folk Festivals, and other festivals, tours, and concerts sponsored by the National Council for the Traditional Arts (NCTA), formerly the National Folk Festival Association founded in 1934. Features performances of ballads, blues, bluegrass, contra dance music, country music, cowboy songs, fiddle tunes, folk music, gospel music, hymns, old-time music, singer songwriters, steel band music, storytelling, Western swing, and more; with numerous performers playing music from African, African American, American Indian, Cajun, Canadian, Caribbean, Eastern European, Hawaiian, Irish, Latin American, Mexican, Scottish, Sea Islands, Sicilian, Ukrainian, and many other traditions from throughout the United States and from around the world. Manuscripts include documentation from the containers of the original sound recordings.

The collection includes a database with track-level information, performers associated with each track, musical styles, identifiers, and technical metadata about the recordings. Recording artists and music categories are listed in the Primary Recording Artists and Genres lists in this finding aid. Complete lists of performers can be found in the Appendix: Full List of Recording Artists. Please contact the Folklife Reading Room with requests.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The bulk of the collection (series 1) are recordings, which are divided into subseries according to the type of event documented (music and folklife or field recordings). Most physical carriers (tape reels, cassettes, DATs, and CD-Rs) have been digitized. NCTA original identifiers were replaced by sr (sound recording) identifiers. Original identifiers have been maintained in the NCTA database, where there are corresponding sr numbers. Series 2 encompasses paper materials removed from tape boxes, inventories, lists of artists, and container documentation from original sound recording formats.

list.item:
Series 1. National Council for the Traditional Arts (NCTA) events and other recordings, ca. 1961-2008
Subseries 1. Music and folklife events, ca. 1971-2008
Subseries 2. Field recordings, ca. 1961-2007

controlaccess.head: Selected Search Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the LC Catalog. They are grouped by name of person or organization, by subject or location, and by occupation and listed alphabetically.

subject.part: Folk dance music--Nova Scotia--Cape Breton Island.

did.unittitle: Series 1. National Council for the Traditional Arts (NCTA) events and other recordings, ca. 1961-2008

scopecontent.p: Documentation from events in which the National Council for Traditional Arts was either the organizer or participant. Includes recordings of festival performances, musical tours, concerts, jam sessions, parties, radio broadcasts, oral history interviews, and NEA Heritage Fellowship award ceremonies. Also includes log sheets for many performances.

did.unittitle: Subseries 1. Music and folklife events, ca. 1971-2008

scopecontent.p: Recordings from musical events that NCTA organized, such as folk festivals, musical tours, concert series, and concerts.

Library of Congress recordings of Senator Robert Byrd at the Library of Congress and at Senator Byrd's home. Recorded by Alan Jabbour and Carl Fleischhauer. Features Senator Byrd playing fiddle, singing, and discussing his background and how he learned a song and/or why it was important to him.

did.unittitle: Appendix: Full List of Recording Artists

scopecontent.p: List from the NCTA database includes additional performers accompanying the performers in the Primary Recording Artists list.

List of main recording artists who performed for each event. The names are extracted from the "Recording Artists" field of the NCTA database. See Access and Restrictions section for more information about the NCTA database. The list is provided to show the range of performers represented in the collection. See Appendix: Full List of Recording Artists for additional performers accompanying the performers in this list.

List of styles and genres of music, dance, storytelling, and crafts assigned to each performer in the collection. The terms are extracted from the "Music Categories" field of the NCTA database. The list is provided to show the types of classification that NCTA's events covered. Nearly every recording and track has at least one of these terms applied to it. See Access and Restrictions section for more information about the NCTA database.

odd.head: Primary Recording Artists
odd.p: The following is a list extracted from the "Recording Artists" field of the NCTA database. See Access and Restrictions section for more information about the NCTA database. The list is provided to show the range of musicians and bands represented in the collection. See Appendix: Recording Artists for additional performers accompanying the musicians and bands in this list, as well as instrumentation.

odd.head: Genres
odd.p: The following is a list extracted from the "Music Categories" field of the NCTA database. It is provided to show the types of classification that NCTA's events covered - musical styles, dance, crafts, and other arts. Nearly every recording and track has at least one of these terms applied to it. See Access and Restrictions section for more information about the NCTA database.
